content:
STRATEGIC PLAN
2023-24

We reviewed the information you have provided and developed a strategic plan FY 2023-2024. Our goal is to provide you with services and resources to help to improve your quality of life and make a difference in our community.

Many of you have expressed that after completing the program you feel lost that there is nothing in the community to support your recovery in 2023 SSCRI will implement three (3) step down programs. The goal of these programs is to support those we serve as they navigate recovery and transition through life’s challenges.

PEARLS program- Target date March 2023

The Pearls program is an extended case management program designed to help you navigate appointments and provide support as you transition through recovery.

Group Therapy: Women’s Group and Men’s Group. – Target date April 2023

Presently fy2022 60% of our groups are comprised of women and 40% are male. We know that the issues that women face (93% are single parents) and those of male (80% unemployment difficult time obtaining assistance) are uniquely different. The fundamental goal of group therapy is to initiate a sense of belonging or relatability through understanding, which is achieved by sharing common experiences. For this reason, we are developing a Men’s and Women’s therapy groups. Group therapy is found to be most effective when utilized to address a specific concern common to all members of the group.

Supportive Employment – Target Jan 2024

Supported Employment Services” refers to helping people with Mental Health, Substance and development disabilities obtain and maintain competitive employment. Supported employment teaches individuals more about responsibility, self-sufficiency, and independence. We know that many of those we serve have not been employed in some time, You will be working with a job coach who will provide guidance and support.

 

Any input regarding SSCRI strategic goal is greatly appreciated to include, but not limited to methods of face-to-face, telephone, written letter, and/or suggestion box.

Performance Measurement and Management

Reason for Quality Measurement-Management Goal: To improve persons served satisfaction in SSCRI SAIOP/SACOT services.

· SSCRI provides comprehensive behavioral health services to include, clinical assessment, therapy, case management, SAIOP, and SACOT services.

· SSCRI conducts daily consumers’ satisfaction through the use of the Group Treatment Feedback Form, which provides daily assessment of consumers’ satisfaction in the following areas: rating of treatment sessions, consumers’ openness to share in treatment group, favorite part of treatment group, and assessing consumers’ feelings prior and after treatment group.

· Within a week prior to discharge from SSCRI treatment services, each consumer attends discharge orientation. In orientation each consumer is encouraged to complete SSCRI Discharge Measurement Tool survey, which evaluates SSCRI in the 12-core functions of substance abuse treatment including, screening, intake, orientation, assessment, treatment planning, counseling, case management, crisis intervention, consumer education, referrals, reports and record keeping, and consultation with other professionals.

· SSCRI randomly selects a series of Group Treatment Feedback Forms and SSCRI Discharge Measurement Tool surveys to assess SSCRI consumer satisfaction ratings in the above listed categories.

· SSCRI analyzes the randomly selected surveys in an Excel spreadsheet to receive accurate percentage in the above listed categories.

· Once the results are completed, results are reviewed by the Leadership/Management Committee and implementations of organizational changes are discussed (if applicable).

Welcome to Stepping Stones Primary Care!

Meet Our Support Staff

 

Datanya Betts, RN, BSN, DNP-FNP, PMHNP

Datanya is a Family Nurse Practitioner with over 18 years of registered nursing experience in acute care services. She has progressively moved through nursing management positions, beginning with Assistant Director of Nursing to Director of Nursing. She was the Clinical Nurse Manager for a medical-surgical nursing unit for 5 years.

Datanya holds a Doctorate of Science in Nursing with a concentration of Family Nurse Practitioner degree from Winston Salem State University and a Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing from the Daemen College located in Amherst, NY.

Datanya is a member of Sigma Theta Tau International Honor Society of Nursing and currently serves on the Healthcare systems Board and Quality Committee of outreach intervention programs. She received the Nightingale Award for Nursing Excellence and was nominated for the 2019 Nursing Excellence Award for Leadership from Nursing Spectrum.In 2024, Datanya Betts was awarded the psychiatric mental health nurse practitioner certification to expand the scope of her care. Datanya is committed to nursing excellence, improving nursing operations, the value of professionalism, quality outcomes and collaborative practice with patient/family centered care.

Diane Newton – Office Administrator/ LPN
Diane has 30 years experience in various types of nursing. She worked at Walter Reed Military Medical Center in Washington, DC, as well as, Kaiser Permanente Pediatrics Urgent Care for the past 20yrs. She’s looking forward to applying all her experiences to give great care to all our patients at Stepping Stones Primary Care.

Svetlana Small – Front Desk Coordinator

April Reid – Certified Medical Assistant

title: Primary Care – About Us
content:
Stepping Stones Primary Care is committed to being the main point of contact for continuing care for patients within our health care system. We are dedicated to health promotion, disease prevention, health maintenance, counseling, patient education, diagnosis, and treatment.

We provide screening of all major health-related conditions. If you already have a chronic condition, we help manage it to improve your quality of life. We screen for many things, including obesity, high blood pressure, and diabetes.

If needed, we will collaborate with other health professionals by utilizing consultation or referral as appropriate to provide cost-effective health care.

We provide “FAMILY CARE” from 5 years old through geriatrics.

The committee’s main objective is protecting the rights of persons served at Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc. and is made up of past and current persons served, stakeholders and staff members.
The committee meetings are held at 3904-A Airport Drive, Wilson NC and lunch will be served.

Parents Guide to Getting Good Care

When a child is struggling, or his behavior worries you, it can be hard to know whether you need to reach out to a professional. And if you do seek help, what kind of professional, and what kind of treatment, are right for your child? In this guide, we take you through the steps to finding the best professional (or team) for your child, and the most appropriate treatment for the disorder or disability. Along the way, we offer things to look for and questions to ask to ensure that you’re getting the quality care your child deserves.

title: Spreading Seeds
content:
Spreading Seeds, Inc. is a Non-Profit 501 (c) (3) organization located in Wilson, NC.

Spreading Seeds is where PASSION and PURPOSE come together.

Spreading Seeds is a non-profit organization created to fill the gaps in care for low-income Veterans, families, recovering addicts, and those facing a life hardship.

Spreading Seeds provides food through cooperation with the NC Food Bank. In addition, we can provide household items, small appliances, clothing, shoes, hygiene items, and furniture through our Clothing and Household Banks. Other services we offer are guidance counseling, empowerment classes, case management, fitness, nutrition, and community connection resources.

title: Early Warning Signs of Substance Abuse
excerpt:
If you answer “yes” to one or more of the following questions it can be an early warning sign of abuse or addiction:
Does the individual find it difficult to have a good time without using substances?
Have others expressed concerns about the individual’s alcohol or drug use?
Has drinking and drug use caused relationship problems for the individual?
Has drinking or drug use caused the individual to show signs of illness (shakiness, vomiting, sluggish, withdrawn, paranoia, depression)?
Has …
content:
If you answer “yes” to one or more of the following questions it can be an early warning sign of abuse or addiction:

  • Does the individual find it difficult to have a good time without using substances?
  • Have others expressed concerns about the individual’s alcohol or drug use?
  • Has drinking and drug use caused relationship problems for the individual?
  • Has drinking or drug use caused the individual to show signs of illness (shakiness, vomiting, sluggish, withdrawn, paranoia, depression)?
  • Has drinking or drug use caused problems with the individual’s primary responsibilities (work, school, caring for children or other loved ones)?
  • Has the individual ever tried to stop using alcohol or drugs but was unsuccessful?
  • Has drinking or drug use caused any legal complications?

title: Early Warning Signs of Behavioral/Mental Health Disorder
excerpt:
If you are suffering from one or more of the following feelings or behaviors, they can be an early warning sign of a mental health disorder:
Yelling or fighting with family and friends
Eating too much or too little
Sleeping too much or too little
Pushing people away
Not wanting to or doing usual activities
Having low or no energy
Feeling numb
Feeling like nothing matters
Experiencing unexplained aches and pains
Feeling helpless
Feeling of hopelessness
Smoking, drinking, or …
content:
If you are suffering from one or more of the following feelings or behaviors, they can be an early warning sign of a mental health disorder:

  • Yelling or fighting with family and friends
  • Eating too much or too little
  • Sleeping too much or too little
  • Pushing people away
  • Not wanting to or doing usual activities
  • Having low or no energy
  • Feeling numb
  • Feeling like nothing matters
  • Experiencing unexplained aches and pains
  • Feeling helpless
  • Feeling of hopelessness
  • Smoking, drinking, or using drugs more than usual
  • Feeling unusually confused or forgetful
  • Being on edge
  • Experiencing unusual anger
  • Feeling extremely upset, worried, or scared
  • Experiencing severe mood swings that cause problems in relationships
  • Having persistent thoughts, you can’t get out of your head
  • Hearing voices
  • Thinking of harming yourself or others
  • Inability to perform daily tasks

content:
Welcome To Karma

Use this section to talk about your company, products or services. Display a friendly video or static image to show your customers that you respect and appreciate them. Absolutely everything is possible with Karma 4.0.

Theme Design Options


With Karma 4.0 Homepage Templates are a thing of the past. You can now effectively build/create your own homepage using the page templates we have provided. Combine that with the super awesome shortcodes included with the theme and the possibilities are virtually endless. Have Fun & Happy Creating!


 

Compatible

UberMenu, Gravity Forms, and MailChimp Plugins are just some of the premium plugins that work seamlessly with Karma.

 

Dependable

Karma is built on highly optimized code that’s already powering more than 20,000 websites. You can depend on this theme.

 

Flexible

Personalize your website by choosing from 30 preset color schemes, 7 gorgeous overlay patterns and so much more.


our customers say it best:

I will be using Karma on my next project as well.–Janet

title: FAQ – 1
excerpt: General Karma Wordpress Theme Can I really use a slider on any page layout? Yes. Karma now offers the ability to insert a slider on every page template. When creating a page you’ll simply use Karma’s custom ‘Slider Settings’ section of the Page Editing screen to customize and insert your Slider. We’ve made sure to [...]
content:
General

Karma WordPress Theme

  • Can I really use a slider on any page layout?

    Yes. Karma now offers the ability to insert a slider on every page template. When creating a page you’ll simply use Karma’s custom ‘Slider Settings’ section of the Page Editing screen to customize and insert your Slider. We’ve made sure to stay true to the default WordPress interface so absolutely nothing new to learn. Gone are the days of being locked down to a “homepage template”. Boo-yah!

  • Is it true I can have unlimited Gallery Pages?

    Indeed it is. In Karma 4.0 we have made it possible to create unlimited Gallery Pages using Parent and Child Categories. First you will go to Gallery Posts > Categories in the WordPress backend, then create a Category, by default it will be a Parent. Now any category you create after just select that previous category as a parent. Each Parent Category represents its own gallery. So now all you have to do is choose the parent category in the page editor for the page you wish to display the gallery on.

  • Can I use Shortcodes in a Blog Post?

    Yes you can. We have taken the liberty of putting together some recommended shortcodes for the blog. For recommended Columns Click Here. And for other Shortcode examples Click Here.

  • How is it I can build my own homepage?

    We won’t get into all the technical jargen. We will however say it is as easy as riding a bike. In Karma 4.0 there is no set homepage layout. We have given you the option to use any of the layout templates (Left Sidebar, Right Nav + Sidebar, ect.) as your homepage layout. Also in the Page Editor we have allowed you to turn off certain elements such as the Title Bar to better suit your homepage needs. Combine that with being able to put a slider on any page and VOILA, you get to make your own homepage. Once again, Have Fun!

  • Can I use Google Fonts with Karma 4.0?

    You bet you can. Just travel on over to the custom Site Options Panel (Appearance > Site Options > Fonts). When there you will have the ability to choose from 11 preset samples we have provided for the Google Fonts. Or you have the option to enter your own custom font. Cheers!


Design

Beautifully crafted

  • Is it possible to customize the layout and design of my website’s Header area?

    Yes indeed. Karma offers a variety of super easy-to-use styling options for a fully custom Header design. Toggle the top-toolbar, adjust the header height, add widgets, select a custom pattern overlay image and more. You can also use Karma’s powerful logo options to position your company’s logo to the left, right or center.

  • What are some of the color scheme options that come with this theme?

    Karma was designed by an award-winning graphic design team. It comes packed with 30 gorgeous color schemes making Karma the perfect WordPress theme for every type of business. Powerful administration options also enable you to build your very own custom color scheme. Oh and you can also choose a color scheme on a per-page basis allowing for a different color scheme on each and every page of your website.

  • Does Karma display nicely on Retina display?

    Yes indeed. Over 90% of the Karma theme is completely retina-ready right out of the box. The image frame shortcodes are one of the only non-retina items however they still look super-duper gorgeous. Uploading a Retina-ready logo is only a mouse click away. Fire up your retina display and go have a look – you won’t be disappointed.

  • Any other design customizations I should know about?

    Yes. There are an absolute abundant amount of design and customization options available in this theme. The even cooler part is that we’ve spent an incredible amount of time in the planning and implementation of these options ensuring that every option baked into Karma is only a few mouse clicks away. Be sure to check out the Design section of this demo site for a more in-depth look.


Features

Built for the future

  • Does this theme come pre-translated into any other Languages?

    Yes. Karma comes translated in over 10 international languages. We’ve invested time and money to ensure that you can translate your website with the utmost ease. Languages include: English, Čeština, Deutsch, Español, Français, Italiano, Chinese, Nederlands, Polski, Português, Русский, Türkçe, Japanese.

  • I see that Karma is Accessibility Compliant. What is Accessibility and why it is important?

    Web accessibility means that people with disabilities can use and access your website. More specifically, Web accessibility means that people with disabilities can perceive, understand, navigate, and interact with the Web, and that they can contribute to the Web. During the re-build of Karma we teamed up with an Accessibility Expert to audit the theme and provide guidance about where to improve the theme for greater accessibility.

  • Does Karma freely include popular plugins such as LayerSlider and Revolution Slider?

    Yes. We’ve invested a nice chunk of money to provide you with the highly popular LayerSlider, Slider Revolution and 3D CU3ER Slider Plugins. Karma is fully optimized, seamlessly integrated and ready to rock-and-roll right out of the box. All plugins are kept entirely up to date so that you can keep your money in your pocket and add amazing functionality to your website.

  • Do you offer free customer support with the Karma theme?

    You betchya! In many ways you could say that our main product is outstanding theme support. It’s what we work on the hardest. 90% of our staff is in some way dedicated to this process. Purchase this theme with confidence in knowing that you will be fully backed by a dedicated team of amazingly friendly website professionals.

  • Any other features I should know about?

    Yes. There is an absolute boatload of additional features included in this theme. The most important feature is that Karma is actually usable. We’ve got a combined 10 years working in the trenches at high-cost marketing firms so we absolutely know what it takes to build a successful and usable website. We continue to get repeat customers because Karma is just so darn easy to use. Please be sure to check out the Features section of this demo site for a more in-depth look.

It is also known as Emancipation Day, Juneteenth Independence Day, and Black Independence Day. On June 19, 1865, Major General Gordon Granger arrived in Galveston, TX, and announced the end of the Civil War and the end of slavery. Although the Emancipation Proclamation came 2½ years earlier on January 1, 1863, many slave owners continued to hold their slaves captive after the announcement, …

title: DWI Services
content:
Did you get a DWI or a Criminal Drug Charge? Well, you’ve come to the right place!


Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc., “FIX MY DWI” Services has a state-licensed facility in Wilson, NC, to perform DWI and Substance Abuse Assessments, evaluate the results and provide recommended DWI or Substance Abuse treatment.

A DWI Assessment, also known as an Alcohol Assessment, is required of anyone who is convicted of DWI in the state of North Carolina. You cannot receive a Limited Driving Privilege without a DWI Assessment.

We also provide Out-Of-State Reviews.

If you receive a criminal drug charge, whether a misdemeanor or felony, the court will more than likely require you to get a Substance Abuse Assessment. We provide the assessment, evaluate the results, and provided recommended Substance Abuse treatment.

****Obtaining a proper assessment and treatment for a DWI or a criminal drug charge can potentially help you if obtained ahead of your court date.

We have Certified Substance Abuse Counselors to guide you through your treatment.

Treatment Options:

Alcohol & Drug Education Traffic School (ADETS)  $160

ADETS is an educational program for someone with a DWI conviction. This program is for people who don’t have an identified substance use disorder but may be at risk for these disorders.

Short-Term Treatment  20/30

Short-term substance abuse treatment consists of 20 hours of counseling covered over a minimum of 30 days. First-Time Offenders receive individual and group counseling on chemical dependency issues.

Long-Term Treatment 40/60

Long-term substance abuse treatment consists of 40 hours of counseling covered over a minimum of 60 days. Includes group and individual counseling over a longer period of time.

90 Day Treatment

Intensive outpatient treatment including group and individual counseling.

120 Day Treatment

Intensive outpatient treatment including group and individual counseling.


Request An Appointment


 

Assessment

We can help you get back on your feet and on the road.

 

Counseling

We are committed to providing needed services for those who have received a DWI.

 

Accomplishment

We’ll make sure that you are ready to drive again.


We offer FREE TRANSPORTATION to and from your assessment and treatments with us. 

Visit us at http://www.YESFixMyDWI.com or

Call us today at (855) YES FIX MY DWI that’s (855) 937-3496

title: Case Management
content:
Case Management is a service for adults, women who are pregnant and children age three (3) and older who have a serious emotional disturbance, mental illness, or a substance abuse related disorder.

Case Management assists recipients in gaining access to necessary care and medical, behavioral, social, housing and other services appropriate to their needs. It is individualized, person-centered, empowering, comprehensive, strengths-based, and outcome-focused.

The functions of Case Management include: Case Management Assessment; Person Centered Planning; Referral/Linkage; and Monitoring/Follow-up.

title: SAIOP
content:
Substance Abuse Intensive Outpatient Program (SAIOP) is a structured individual and group addiction activities and services that are provided at an outpatient program with the goals of assisting adults and adolescents to begin recovery and learn life skills for recovery maintenance.

The program is offered at least 3 hours a day, at least 3 days a week, with no more than 2 consecutive days between offered services, and distinguishes between those individuals needing no more than 15 hours of structured services per week.

We provide quality treatment in areas of anger management, mood disorders, anxiety disorders, attention deficit hyperactivity disorders (ADHD), behavioral disorders, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), stress management, substance abuse disorders, gambling addiction disorders, eating disorders, and obsessive-compulsive disorders. title: Behavioral/Mental Health
content:
Behavioral/Mental Health affects how we think, feel, and act. It includes our emotional, mental, and overall well-being. It also controls how we handle stress, make choices, and relate to others. Your thinking, mood, and behavior could be affected if you experience mental health problems.

There are many causes that can play apart in behavioral/mental health problems, including:

  • Family history of mental health problems
  • Biological factors, such as genes or brain chemistry
  • Life experiences, such as trauma or abuse

Behavioral/Mental Health problems are universal and we can help you get better and set you on a path of complete recovery.


 

Identify

Don’t suffer any longer.

 

Get Help

We are committed to providing the needed treatment for those who want to get well.

 

Succeed

Let us help you achieve your goals to a better life.


With our support you can overcome Behavioral/Mental Health Disorders.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: Substance Abuse
content:
Substance Abuse is the misuse and abuse of alcohol, over-the-counter medications, illicit drugs, and tobacco. It’s the overindulgence in or dependence on an addictive substance.

Substance Abuse can lead to addiction and elevated health risks. It can modify a person’s judgement and/or thinking leading to life altering and destructive decisions.


Acknowledge

Don’t wait till it’s too late to get the treatment you need.

Achieve

We know with the proper treatment everyone can be successful in beating substance abuse.

Succeed

We’re here to help those who want to get on the road to recovery!


We can help you beat Substance Abuse.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: History
content:
Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc., established in 2012 under the leadership of Dr. Jessica Newton Banks. We are located in Wilson County, Wilson, North Carolina. In addition, we have DWI Services in Wilson North Carolina.

In 2013, 2016, 2019, and again in 2023, Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc. was awarded a CARF (Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities) International Three-Year Accreditation making us globally recognized for our practice of excellence.

Accreditation demonstrates a provider’s commitment to continuously improve service quality and to focus on the satisfaction of the persons served.  


 

Quality Care
